SEARCH
Package io.brane.rpc

Class MulticallBatch

java.lang.Object
io.brane.rpc.MulticallBatch
public final class MulticallBatch extends Object
Orchestrates a batch of Multicall3 requests.

This class captures multiple contract calls and bundles them into a single eth_call using the Multicall3 contract.

IMPORTANT: ThreadLocal Cleanup Requirement

This class uses a ThreadLocal to temporarily store call metadata between a proxy method call and the subsequent add(Object) call. You MUST ensure that every proxy method call is followed by an add() call, or explicitly call clearPending() to prevent ThreadLocal leaks.

Leak Detection: If you call a proxy method twice without calling add() in between, an IllegalStateException is thrown and the stale pending call is automatically cleared. However, this is a fail-safeâ€”you should not rely on it.

Safe Patterns: 


 // Pattern 1: Direct chaining (recommended)
 var handle = batch.add(myContract.myMethod(arg));  // Safe - add() clears pending

 // Pattern 2: Try-finally for complex logic
 try {
     var result = myContract.myMethod(arg);
     // ... validation or other logic that might throw ...
     handle = batch.add(result);
 } catch (Exception e) {
     batch.clearPending();  // Prevent ThreadLocal leak
     throw e;
 }

 // Pattern 3: Using hasPending() for debugging
 assert !batch.hasPending() : "Unexpected pending call";

Warning: If you use this class in a thread pool or virtual thread context, be especially careful to clear pending calls. ThreadLocals in pooled threads can persist across task boundaries, causing memory leaks or incorrect behavior.

See Also:
  • clearPending()
  • hasPending()

  • Method Details

    • allowFailure

      public MulticallBatch allowFailure(boolean allowFailure)
      Sets whether individual calls are allowed to fail without reverting the entire batch.
      Parameters:
      allowFailure - true to allow failure, false to revert batch on any failure
      Returns:
      this batch instance

    • chunkSize

      public MulticallBatch chunkSize(int chunkSize)
      Sets the maximum number of calls per RPC request.
      Parameters:
      chunkSize - the maximum number of calls per chunk
      Returns:
      this batch instance

    • bind

      public <T> T bind(Class<T> contractInterface, Address address, String abiJson)
      Binds a contract interface to a recording proxy for batched calls.

      The returned proxy records all method invocations without executing them. Calls are batched and executed together when execute() is called. Method return values are wrapped in

      invalid reference 
      CompletableFuture
      to retrieve results after batch execution.

      Example usage: 

      
 MulticallBatch batch = publicClient.createBatch();

 // Bind contracts
 ERC20 token = batch.bind(ERC20.class, tokenAddress, ERC20_ABI);

 // Record calls (these don't execute yet)
 CompletableFuture<BigInteger> balance1 = batch.add(token.balanceOf(addr1));
 CompletableFuture<BigInteger> balance2 = batch.add(token.balanceOf(addr2));

 // Execute all calls in a single RPC request
 batch.execute();

 // Get results
 BigInteger b1 = balance1.get();
 BigInteger b2 = balance2.get();
      Type Parameters:
      T - the contract interface type
      Parameters:
      contractInterface - the interface to bind (must be an interface)
      address - the contract address
      abiJson - the contract ABI in JSON format
      Returns:
      a recording proxy instance
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null
      See Also:
      • add(Object)
      • execute()

    • add

      public <T> BatchHandle<T> add(T ignore)
      Adds a recorded call to the batch and returns a handle for the result.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the return type of the call
      Parameters:
      ignore - the result of the proxy call (ignored)
      Returns:
      a handle to the eventual result
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no call was recorded prior to calling add

    • clearPending

      public boolean clearPending()
      Clears any pending call that was recorded but not added to the batch.

      IMPORTANT: Call this method in a finally block or catch handler if an exception might occur between a proxy method call and add(Object). This prevents ThreadLocal leaks that can cause memory issues in thread pools and virtual thread contexts.

      Example: 

      
 try {
     var result = myContract.myMethod(arg);
     // ... code that might throw ...
     handle = batch.add(result);
 } catch (Exception e) {
     batch.clearPending();  // Prevent ThreadLocal leak
     throw e;
 }

      This method is safe to call even if there is no pending call (returns false).

      Returns:
      true if a pending call was cleared, false if there was nothing to clear

    • hasPending

      public boolean hasPending()
      Returns true if there is a pending call that was recorded but not yet added.

      This can be useful for debugging or asserting state in tests.

      Returns:
      true if a call is pending, false otherwise

    • execute

      public void execute()
      Executes the batch of calls in one or more RPC requests (depending on chunk size).
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this batch has already been executed
